question.body: For the presynaptic vesicles to fuse with the presynaptic membrane and release a neurotransmitter into the synaptic area, ___________ ions have to be present in the axoplasm.

response.feedback: Correct. Calcium ions diffuse into the cell through voltage gated Ca channels which causes the synaptic vesicles to fuse with the pre-synaptic membrane and release the neurotransmitter into the synaptic cleft.
Incorrect. Sodiium is responsible for the Action potential, not vesicle formation.
Incorrect. Potassium diffuses out of the cell during recovery from AP.
Incorrect. Chloride channels are not activated.
